item.title: Burberry Backs Outlook After 2023 Improvement
item.description: Burberry reported above-forecast earnings for fiscal 2023, and said that despite the uncertain environment, it was confident of meeting its 2024 and medium-term targets.

item.title: Siemens's 2Q Profitability Hit by Weak Healthineers
item.description: Siemens’s overall second-quarter results exceeded expectations on orders, revenue and cash flow, AlphaValue said, adding that its forecasts should go up, with an expected increase in its target price.

item.title: Metals Slip Despite US Debt Ceiling Hopes as Chinese Demand Worries Return
item.description: Base and precious metals prices moved lower as worries over Chinese demand returned to the fore following Wednesday’s rally on hopes that an agreement over the U.S. debt ceiling would be reached.

item.title: Crude Oil Softens After Wednesday's Rally
item.description: Crude oil prices edged lower having rallied on Wednesday, with ING Think saying the market continued to be driven by external developments, rather than fundamentals, having ignored a largely bearish EIA inventory report.

item.title: Dollar Rises as Debt Ceiling Worries Ease, Rate-Cut Bets Are Trimmed
item.description: The dollar has continued to rise as comments from U.S. politicians increase optimism that a deal on raising the debt ceiling will be reached, boosting appetite for risk and in turn reducing bets on future Fed rate cuts, MUFG said.

item.title: Caution Over Greek Bonds Seen Warranted Ahead of Elections
item.description: Caution over Greek government bonds ahead of Greece’s elections on Sunday is warranted, Citi said, adding that a return of the incumbent New Democracy with a workable majority would be instrumental in getting to an investment grade rating which could then open the door to an inclusion of GGBs in IG indices.

item.title: Philippines Central Bank Keeps Rate Steady as Inflation Slows
item.description: Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas kept its benchmark interest rate unchanged, as expected in a Wall Street Journal poll.

item.title: EasyJet Cuts Losses as Sales Surge
item.description: EasyJet interim losses narrowed as sales rose 80% on strong demand, and said it expected to deliver its medium-term targets sooner.

item.title: BT Sees Growth as Fourth Quarter Tops Hopes
item.description: BT reported an above-consensus 10% rise in adjusted profits in the fourth quarter and said it expected revenue and earnings growth in the year ahead, on a pro forma basis

item.title: Micron Outlines $3.6 Billion Investment With Japan's Backing
item.description: The U.S. chip maker’s deal with Tokyo comes at a time of rising tension between Washington and Beijing over chip technology.

item.title: As Oil Giants Retreat Globally, Smaller Players Rush In
item.description: Energy companies such as BP, TotalEnergies and Chevron are shifting to cleaner projects, creating an opening for independent and private companies to buy up their operations or push ahead with exploration.

item.title: Bitcoin Miner Bit Digital Adds Machines in Iceland Before Possible U.S. Tax Crackdown
item.description: The Biden administration is seeking to impose a big levy on crypto miners.

item.title: Carbon Accounting Changes Could Lift Corporate Greenhouse-Gas Emissions
item.description: Some multinationals might be underestimating their emissions by close to 50% under current rules.

item.title: Ukraine, China Meeting Shows No Breakthrough to End Russian Invasion
item.description: Kyiv’s foreign minister tells Chinese envoy Ukraine can’t accept any proposals that mean losing territory to Russia.

item.title: Fashion Giant Shein Raises $2 Billion but Lowers Valuation by a Third
item.description: The online-only retailer has set a target to grow its revenue by 40% this year, but faces geopolitical headwinds and rising competition.

item.title: Amazon's Cloud Business to Invest More Than $12 Billion in India by 2030
item.description: Amazon.com’s cloud-computing business plans to spend $12.81 billion to expand its data-center infrastructure in India by 2030, part of long-term efforts to boost the global reach of its cloud services.

item.title: For Executives Only, CEOs Amass Billions in Savings With 'Top Hat' Plans
item.description: The top five executives at 500 large publicly traded companies held a combined $8.9 billion in the plans, according to two nonprofits.

item.title: Cancel That Brainstorm. There's a Better Way to Spur Good Ideas.
item.description: Giving workers alone time could yield more innovation than getting everyone in a room, research shows.

item.title: Francisco Partners and TPG are working together on a $5 billion-plus bid to acquire software company New Relic, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.description: Francisco Partners and TPG are working together on a $5 billion-plus bid to acquire software company New Relic, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: Theranos founder Holmes must report to prison by May 30, a judge said, after a court denied her request to remain free pending appeal of her conviction.
item.description: Theranos founder Holmes must report to prison by May 30, a judge said, after a court denied her request to remain free pending appeal of her conviction.
